nodes.text: Lycresh was a fabric that was used to make the riding outfits of the jockeys that rode fathiers on the Canto Bight racetrack on the planet Cantonica. The gear was designed to be lightweight and reduce drag, with the lycresh enveloping the jockeys in a comfortable fit. In 34 ABY, the jockeys Arca Yroca, Pinrado Noza and Shuma Kalamo wore lyrcresh outfits finished in bright attention-grabbing orange, blue and green respectively.

Lycreash first appeared in the 2017 film Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi and was first identified in the accompanying reference book Star Wars: The Last Jedi: The Visual Dictionary, which was written by Pablo Hidalgo.
